document_data.name: Dice
document_data.mainbody:
'''Dice''' ({{Singular|die}}) was "one of the four universal games" of [[Faer√ªn]] along with [[Chess (game)|chess]], [[draughts]], and [[Talis]]. It was played on multiple [[plane]]s of existence.

{{quote|Skilled players at dice and cards and board and murmuring courtiers drifting about thrones both smilingly speak of the endgame when all is decided, and something is won. But inevitably far more is lost. I am no fan of endgames.|[[Vangerdahast Aeiulvana]] in open court in [[Castle Obarskyr]]}}
document_data.Description:
Dice were typically cubes carved from [[ivory]], bone, wood, or even stone. And they were marked with numbers ranging from one to six. Though dice also came in a variety of other geometric shapes that sported more numbers. Typical dice sets came in leather cups, which were often used for rolling them, though others simply shook them in their hands before throwing them on to the floor or table.

Multiple games could be played with dice, such as various gambling games and other bar-entertainment.
document_data.Availability: [[Turmish]] was a known producer of dice, and [[Aurora's Emporium]] sold dice imported from that country.

document_data.History:
[[File:Crystal Dice Set.png|thumb|''A set of crystal dice.'']]
Some gambling establishments had [[wizard]]s on staff in order to thwart the use of [[item enchantment|enchanted]] dice.
